reviewText:
This game is realistic, soetimes too realistic and this can be its downfall. Wether we love it or hate it we cant deny that for football fans this holds our attention.
There are aspects to this game that have bugged fans for years and whilst they may differ it doesnt stop us playing. From too many injuries to losing one game then losing the following 10 these things frustrate us yet we are still drawn to it.

This latest installement is no different injuries are still plaguing teams, losing out in cups to a team 60 places below you 3-0  all while the developers say the game engine throw these up to add realistic pressure to the player" whilst i can help but admire this attitude this sounds a little to much like the word "FIXED". On this note i would say without saving before matches and exploring every option and player under the sun (we have all done it once in a while) your destined to have the league goto the final game of the season every season (mine has for every edition of the FM series) or a cup match goto extra time and penalties to really tire your players out and injure them so your assault on the league is properly "realistically pressurised".

Whilst there are these problems and frustrations i still play this and have hours of fun
date: agreed there is no perfect game and this is still in the BETA. these faults wont stop people buying or playing it. Maybe in the future they would consider a realistic slider in the options to allow better experiences for those players who simply love the simulation and a game that has a sensible world of soccer feel about it or toning down the injuries. I feel this would dampen alot of the frustration felt by the community on issues that have now become a legacy for the franchise
recommended: such as Ballotelli being one of the most influencial attackers in the game yet nobody wants to buy him.\n\nA quality game where i like to challenge myself to producing an Premier league team with full English talent and win the Champions cup. Thoroughly reccomend this game and would advise any fan to buy it
hoursPlayed: so long as you can hold your temper when your facing 7 first team player out injured and your on a losing streak of 7 games
voteText: if the answer is no dont buy it
helpfulPercent: value your laptop or computer."

The gameplay hasn't changed that much

reviewText:
Football Manager remains as one of the best football managing sims out there to date. Even though I haven't clocked that much YET in this game, I've already clocked thousands of hours into FM 10,11, and 14. This year's version boasts a couple of changes that bring a new face to the game.

PROS:
-Management roughly every team in the whole known football league
-Mods and updates from community can keep the game alive
-Football
-New tactic interface looks sweet

Neutral:
-The new UI interface is a bit weird for me as I've been used to older aliterations, but that's a minor thing.
-Injuries are quite annoying. I've gotten around 6 injuries before the start of the season, though I am playing a lower league team in the non-league football, so I guess it is justified.
-Japan and German don't have real players in the national team due to licencing issues, but can be fixed with a mod.

There's not that much cons from my point of view, but I haven't gotten that far yet to notice. So all in all I would recommend this game. You might be confused at the beginning, but once you understand it, you will not let go. I once stayed on one save for 20 years of management with Vauxhall as the best team in the world. Now if you would excuse me, I have a team to bring to the Premier League.

reviewText: I upgraded from FM2014. All the reviews said that the changes are very minor and it's not worth buying the game. The reviews said the same for FM15, so that's why I didn't buy it last year. Actually, my major reason for buying the 2016 version was to get the new start your own club" mode.\n\nAfter playing 27 hours
date: I must say that I'm surprised that the reviews were not more positive. The match AI is significantly improved. Players behave a lot more like people and a lot less like clueless robots. Stats for players in low level clubs (like my own home club Piteå IF) are still completely wrong and far from reality. Since I volunteered to correct it
recommended: and just got a reply "we've got a guy already on that"
hoursPlayed: I'm quite disappointed that they lied to me about this. But the game is still a lot better than the 2014 version so I think it's worth the money to move up in versions.\n\nThe one thing I was looking forward to most
voteText: create your club mode... No... it's severely limited
helpfulPercent: and the UI is locked to some simpleton mode where I can't get full information about players etc. So it doesn't work at all like I had hoped
votesHelpful: and I will not be playing it. I will be much happier about playing the league management though
votesTotal: because of the AI upgrades."

reviewText:
A must have for any football enthusiasts.
Not too much has changed from its previous versions; but why fix something which ain't broken?

Pick your favourite team, try and remove those players you don't like and try bringing in those 2 or 3 superstars who'll bring your team success. Hire and Fire your staff, create your personalised formations, let your favourite player take those set-pieces. Even setup in-game tactics. There's alot for you to do here.

Apart from being lucky enough to do it as a profession, this is certainly the closest you'll get to it!
Played the FM franchise for years and I'm still lovin' it.

My only personal grip is that I'm an Arsenal fan (i.e. English Premiership); and its slightly annoying that you dont get their badges or kits due to 'licensing'. For much a successful game - would it hurt THAT much to break the bank for the preimer league?

reviewText:
I have been playing this game since 2012, and have never stopped playing.  It became a vital part of my life, yet my friends advised me to stop playing this game because it has 'no meaning of life' particularly 'sad life'.  I ignored, am keen to keep playing and tried to become the best manager in my save-game.

Although there are some negatives which can be improved, there are lots of positives and I assure you that each year it gets better.  Yes, each year you might be facing minor improvements, but MINOR can make the differences!  For me, I'm grateful to buy this game, and, although I can be frustrated occassionally when the game could have done better to improve, I am satisfied.

Remember, there are other games that may have football manager, but they DO NOT have ALL the aspects of this game that has.  This game is the most realistic, actual sports simulation game where you would face many vary ways of playing the game.  You manage, you control the finance, you sell the players, you use the tactic to suit the players, you use your backroom staff advice, you improve the players, you use the youth facility to improve the youth players, you watch the game, you see how your team plays, you see what your team needs to improve, you change the tactic, and so, so on.... I could list on, even if that would take millions of years to list on.

Admittedly, this game is over-priced.  No comment.

8/10 - looking forward to many years yet to come

reviewText:
I've played other FM games, and this one is my favorite.
The UI is brought back to the sidebar up the right side of the screen.
I don't find this to be a problem, and I actually think it's VERY easy to navigate throughout this game. Everything is very simple and easy to find, which I found to be kind of a problem in previous games.

The simulations are SO much better in this game vs. in older games where my players would stop moving look around and someone from the opposite team would sneak up and steal it and no one would notice. No. This game eliminates most of these annoyances and players actually seem to have some form of intelligence.
Not to mention the simulations and games look a lot better, graphically speaking.
I was actually watching a video of someone playing a match on YouTube, and a friend of mine legitimately thought I was watching a real soccer game.

There is a new feature where you can make your own character and give them a look and all that... I actually really didn't like it. My character looks like a burn victim who is halfway through a sneeze.

Another feature allows you to create your own club, which I haven't tried yet, but am really looking forward to spending time with it.

Overall, I love this game and it's my favorite FM in the series.

10/10

reviewText: I have to say that i'm happy with how the game has developed over the years, since i did play the Manager since 2003, but i still don't like that some of the players wouldn't even consider moving to your squad even if you compete in the ECL, and have enough money for their contract. I understand that they dislike the lower divisions, or less atractive leagues (like Serbian SuperLeague for example), but, if you'r doing more than decent with your club, they shuld consider atleast the offer. In the real life, Indian league, Chineese league etc. are getting some world class footballers only 'cause they have money... So, why wouldn't it be like that in less attractive leagues? I had an issue of getting Stevan Jovetic to FK Partizan Belgrade, even when he's out of contract, also the goalie Buffon... Even Ronaldinho... No club, no contract, no interested clubs... And i'm in the knock-out phase of the ECL...\nThat's my oppinion...\nAnd, i had some issues on the achievements... I played challenges, i also made my board build a new stadium (for example), yet, i didn't get the achievement...

reviewText: Do you like Football? Do you want to know what it's like to manage a club? Then this is the game for you. Football Manager is a game that revolves around you being the manager of your favourite club. It puts you at the heart of the club and lets you decide its future. With a wide database of players it gives great oppurtunities for fantastic transfer deals as well as having a wide variety of different routes you can go down in terms of training and personal decisions. This game is a huge improvment from last years game and it is incredibly detailed right down to the title page. All in all if you're not a fan of football games where you play for the team yourself, then this is the perfect game for you. Its detail and databases are unrivalled making this, in my opinion the best football game out there. I would definitely reccommend it!

I absoltely love this game, had a great save with liverpool and couldn't get enough of it. But as of last night it is un-playable, The game won't load any of my save and even if i start a new game i can't save it. I have tried numberous ways of fixing the problem, none of them working and with the forums not showing a way to fix this issue i have given up.

I'm so ♥♥♥♥♥♥ off cause this game was perfect until this and i hadn't encountered any problems before, but now this bug or glitch has ruined it and i can no longer play the game. RIP FM 2016 .

P.S if anyone does have a way to fix this ( A way that actuall works ) please let me know!
